content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(word -> isuppercase(first(word)), words)
end
```

This function uses the `filter` function, which applies a predicate (in this case, a lambda function that checks if the first character of each word is an uppercase letter using the `isuppercase` function) to the elements in the collection. The filtered results are then returned. 

To use this function with some sample data:

```julia
words = ["dog", "Cat", "Dog", "Catman"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println.(filtered_words)
```

In the above code, `println.(filtered_words)` will print each word in the list after the operation has been performed.
